definition: to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help

sentences.english: The effectiveness of the rider's aids determines the precise fulfilment of the required movements of the tests.
sentences.chinese: 骑手扶助的效率，决定执行测验中的动作的精准度。

sentences.english: Maybe I would donate my time and work with the Better Business Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 也许我会把时间贡献出来为商业扶助局工作。

sentences.english: I possibly even helped the children in the neighbourhood with their lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我帮他们干农活，扶助邻家的孩子温习功课。

sentences.english: When I said, 'My foot is slipping,' your love, O Lord , supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我正说我失了脚，耶和华阿，那时你的慈爱扶助我。

sentences.english: In judging be merciful to the fatherless as a father, and as a husband to their mother.
sentences.chinese: 对待孤儿应如慈父，扶助他们的母亲，应如丈夫。

sentences.english: Background analysis of the system of encouragement and assist.
sentences.chinese: 奖励扶助制度实施的背景分析。

sentences.english: We are willing to befriend the weak and the poor.
sentences.chinese: 我们愿意扶助弱者与穷人。

sentences.english: Budget pressures have made them highly reluctant to spend money on helping the incomers.
sentences.chinese: 预算压力使他们很难倾囊扶助外来人口。

sentences.english: We need more support measures, " Chen said.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要更多的扶助措施。

sentences.english: The second part is the constituting and actualization of the hortation and assist system.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是奖励扶助制度的出台。

sentences.english: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.
sentences.chinese: 我们凡事不能敌挡真理，只能扶助真理。

sentences.english: Focus on people who help, not hinder you
sentences.chinese: 专注于能扶助你的人，而非妨害你的人。

sentences.english: She received help from the Family Reach Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 她从家庭关爱基金会也得到过扶助。

sentences.english: The soul aids the body, and at certain moments, raises it.
sentences.chinese: 灵魂扶助肉体，某些时刻甚至还能提挈它。

definition: to help one another/to come to sb's help
to support the weak and restrain the strong (idiom); robbing the rich to help the poor
emergency relief/to help the needy with cash or goods
lit. widowers, widows, orphans and the childless/fig. people with no one left to rely on
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
assistance/a helping hand/to lend a hand
misfortune/crisis/grave danger/critical situation/disaster/emergency/to be zealous in helping others out of a predicament
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to bolster/to give a boost to (the economy etc)
